title:
Analysis of NOvA and MicroBooNE charged-current inclusive neutrino
  measurements within the SuSAv2 framework
authors: J. Gonzalez-Rosa, G. D. Megias, J. A. Caballero and M. B. Barbaro
abstract:
In this work we compare the SuSAv2 model, based on the superscaling
phenomenon and the relativistic mean field theory, with charged-current
inclusive neutrino cross sections from the NOvA and MicroBooNE experiments,
whose targets are composed primarily by 12 C and 40 Ar, respectively. The
neutrino energy in these experiments covers a kinematic range from tens of MeV
to roughly 20 GeV. Thus, we consider the different reaction mechanisms that
contribute significantly to these kinematics, namely quasielastic, two-particle
two-hole meson exchange currents, resonances and deep inelastic scattering
contributions.
